entry.title: Python OpenCV Adjusting Camera Parameters
entry.content:
I was working on a project for object localization using stereo camera. I was facing trouble in processing the active markers accurately. I was trying lot of things and didnâ€™t had much success, just by playing around with camera parameters I was able to get the job done. So here is the python code to set the parameters:

Although the above code is for a stereo camera, if you are using just one camera you can omit one line for each. Also, here is a code that can help vary the parameters with the keys in order to just play around:

Instructions for varying:

  • x-break 
  • w - increase brightness 
  • s - decrease brightness 
  • d - increase contrast 
  • a - decrease contrast 
  • e - increase saturation 
  • q - decrease saturation 
  • z - increase exposure 
  • c - decrease exposure
